esh-adventure-rp
Summary
Welcome to #esh-adventure-rp! This is the start of the #esh-adventure-rp channel.
DM [Esh] BOT 17-10-2023 00:36
The Doctor's Enigma Prologue For a while now, Whizzerd has been having odd dreams. Dreams where he is standing in by an opened door, someone he can't recognize laying out on the floor in front of him. The person lets out a moan of pain, barely able to lift herself off the floor, pleading to Whizzerd to help her. Looking her over, Whizzerd sees her entire body is covered in wounds; lacerations, burns and the like but what stands out the most are crystals of various sizes and colors growing out from her body. "What is this?!" Whizzerd hears himself say in shock, "Let me help you inside! What happened to you? Let me take a look and see how I can help!" Fade to black
DM [Esh] BOT 17-10-2023 00:36
. In another, Whizzerd is now standing over a table, a body lays strapped to it, fighting "Please doctor! No!" Whizzerd now sees his hands come into view holding a crystal shard in one and a surgical knife in the other. He brings them towards the patient who screams "NOOOOO!" Fade to black (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 17-10-2023 00:38
. The barbarian remembers another. Laughter starts this one off - "Awwww! Thank you daddy! It's so pretty!!" A little half-orc girl is sitting on your lap holding the little trinket given to her, tightly clutching it to her chest. "Thank you daddy! I'll love it forever!" You pull the little girl closer to your own chest and let out a long-held sigh, "Mira, there's something I need to tell you..."Fade to black (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 17-10-2023 00:43
. In each of these dreams Whizzerd eventually sees a building, a box-like structure made fully of steel. Feelings rise that you've frequented this structure often but you cannot recall why.... You also recall that this building is no more. It had been destroyed in some sort of explosion. Which is why when you're sitting at your usual table at the Black Rabbit Bar some of the other patrons can be overheard that a mysterious building fitting that exact description appeared recently - fully intact but shrouded in Barovia's infamous Mists, you are intrigued, very much so.....
DM [Esh] BOT 17-10-2023 01:08
"Twas the weirdest fookin thing I've seen, man! It just appeared out of NO WHERE! Almost squashed me where I stood it did!" A scrawny man at a table not too far from Whizzerd stands surrounded by an assortment of the bar's various other guests, each a drink in hand at various stages of completion. "PFAHH!" A burly man replies, "This ere's Barovia. We gettin' these arsing "adventures" in daily.. Poppin in like the plague! An they be bringing all sorts with em! Nothing new here Charlie! Come up with a new story if you wan us to cover your drinks for the night!!"
Cassie BOT 17-10-2023 02:21
Cassie is getting a drink at the bar while the conversations are going on. She spies Whizzerd, grabs her drink, and heads his way.
Whizzerd BOT 17-10-2023 03:09
Cassie would see Whizzerd approach Charlie, the half-orca jovial demeanour subdued as he listens to the drunkards tale. Those who have seen Whizzerd before would have noticed the crystal scarring his body seemingly covering more and more of it during his time in Barovia. Though this time the change is more‚Ä¶pronounced as a patch of crystals seems to be growing out of Whizzerd‚Äôs eye. ‚ÄúCould you tell Whizzerd more about this place?‚Äù he asks as he sits at the table with him, ‚ÄúWhizzerd can buy drink if needed.‚Äù
DM [Esh] BOT 17-10-2023 13:20
The man, half-drunk looks up at half-orc. "Huh? Ay! Praise the Morning Lrd! What happened to ya?!" But the words "buy you a drink" seemed to be louder than the crystal deformities. "A drink? The place? Gonna need for the rest of my mates too" he opens his hands towards the four other bozos sitting with him. "Aye! Yous heard Charlie! And drinks for his mates." A large, simple looking man says as he downs the beer he's currently holding in anticipation of another one.
DM [Esh] BOT 18-10-2023 00:10
As Whizzerd is negotiating with the bar patrons the Black Rabbi is as busy as usual. Behind them new contenders enter the ring - a tall wood elf clad in heavy armor and a battle axe and an ashen skinned man. "No rules. Weapons, armor, spells. You have it. Just no deaths! Otherwise the cleaning fee is comin' outa your pay!" A surly dwarf referee shouts out. "GO!" The wood elf's armor reveals glowing runes etched throughout and the elf starts to grow in size eventually towering ten feet tall over the ashen man who simply gives a smile of satisfaction. "More to burn!" He shouts, as he in turn ignites. Hair aflame, eyes burning red, the fire genasi smiles again as he conjures a purple flame in his hand. Holding his hand up the crowd can see the fel flame dancing in his palm, a rabid skull seeking to singe the runic fighter, to which the flaming warlock obliges.
Whizzerd BOT 18-10-2023 00:12
The half-orc puts down a couple of gold coins down and gets to questioning the man. ‚ÄúCould you continue your story? Did you see anyone or anything around it?‚Äù
DM [Esh] BOT 18-10-2023 00:50
Ignoring the battle behind him as the coins clatter on the table, Charlie's grin widens, "Yes, yes. Let me just wet my lips first. LADY!" He calls out to the barmaid as he scoops up the coins. "Another round for the table!" Waving the gold for her to see. Noticing Whizzerd getting impatient Charlie starts before the drinks arrive. "Er.. okay so there I was minding my own business at the edge of the city. Setting up me animal traps near the forest and whatnot, as I usually do." He starts, "What? I'm a trapper. After I catch the vermin I skin em and sell the pelts. Well... Any way, this time the Mists were thicker than usual and... I hate to admit it but I got lost. Eventually I found some houses. None which I seen before. All empty. I checked... The Mists were still 'round though. Thick and heavy like they were stuck to the houses themselves. I kept moving through this strange village. It was like the Mists were showin me where to go. Eventually I reached the outskirts of the town, the mists still thick in the air but alla sudden it cleared up and outta nowhere this huge building appeared. I went to check it out but as I got closer I heard strange noises - screaming, laughing, crying. Comin from the building but also from all around me. After that I ran! Ran until my legs gave out then got up and ran some more! Eventually I made it back and first thing I did is get a drink for all that trauma." With the drinks finally at the table, Charlie looks at Whizzerd unsure what he actually will be doing with the story.. and with a beer courtesy of the half-orc, frankly he didn't care.
Cassie BOT 18-10-2023 02:09
Cassie sidles closer, listening more intently to the conversation.
Whizzerd BOT 18-10-2023 13:55
‚ÄúThe outskirts of town‚Ä¶‚ÄùWhizzerd repeats as a range of emotions appear on his face; sadness, confusion, and something rarely seen on the half-orc, fear. ‚ÄúCould you at least tell Whizzerd what direction?‚Äù
DM [Esh] BOT 18-10-2023 14:25
"Direction?! What kinda fool wants directions?" Charlie asks, shocked that anyone would even think about going near that place but seeing the half-orc's fierce gaze upon him, intimidation, amplified by the crystal growths, Charlie tries his luck once more. "I mean it was so dark and the Mists were so thick. Another round may help jog the memory. Besides, if you go Morning Lord knows you'll make it back for another round afterwards." The rest of the table laughs along with Charlie. "Yeah! Damn shame!" "Surely one more round ain't nothin for a big fella like yous?"
Cassie BOT 18-10-2023 14:41
After taking a moment to clean up her appearance, Cassie steps in and puts an arm around Charlie. "Somehow I don't think another drink is going to help your memory, love," she says, her tone only lightly teasing. "Now, why don't you tell the nice half-orc what he wants to know. And maybe I'll let you buy me a drink?"
DM [Esh] BOT 18-10-2023 16:02
The buxom beauty steps into view and the entire table can hear Charlie's heart skip a beat. After a buddy whistles at the poor sap he finally snaps back to reality, licks his fingers to pat some loose hair down and in his most suave voice says (which isn't that good, not to Cassie's standards any way) "How you doin, Honey? The ghost town north of the forest? Why do you need to know where that empty place is when you have everything right here!" He says as he waves his mug-filled hand around the entire bar, the giant runic knight connecting a slice against the fiery warlock, leaving a long slash of his robe fall to floor, only to get trampled by the combatants. In retaliation, the warlock let's another barrage of fel bolts fly, all hitting its mark except for one stray one that shatters the mug in Charlie's hand. "HEY! I WAS DRINKING THAT!" He shouts. "Well any way, now I'll need another one. Besides this guy!? He's a long time buddy of mine. Bruno, right? Another round and add one for the dame!" As he points to Cassie
Cassie BOT 18-10-2023 16:13
Cassie's glance flicks to Whizzerd when Charlie lets the direction slip. She hopes he picked up on it, but decides that for the moment it's better not to draw attention to it. "A glass of elvish wine for me," she adds with an innocent smile. Perhaps it wasn't fair to toy with this man's heart and wallet, but it was a slow night... She makes a show of paying attention to Charlie, though she keeps an eye on Whizzerd, hoping to speak to him before he leaves.
DM [Esh] BOT 18-10-2023 16:24
Getting comfortable with the guys, Cassie pulls up a seat at the table and listens as they continue their banter. Most of it is hogwash; talking about the fight going on behind them, about the drudgery of work, how many wenches they (failed to) get with... but in between topics and a few more retellings of Charlie's brave adventure through the scary ghost town Cassie had been able to pick up more or less exactly where Charlie got lost and where he discovered this new location.

Once Whizzerd is sure that there‚Äôs no more info that Charlie could give pertaining to the structure Whizzerd leaves the table when Charlie is distracted by the fight. Giving a nod to Cassie before he leaves. Off to a table in the corner of the bar Whizzerd starts taking inventory of his pack. Preparing to make his way to the structure. (edited)
Cassie BOT 18-10-2023 20:05
"Would you excuse me," Cassie says to Charlie. Without waiting for an answer she slips away from the table and approaches Whizzerd. "Copper for your thoughts?" she offers. "Chuck's story seemed to strike a nerve with you. Want to talk about it?"
Whizzerd BOT 18-10-2023 21:23
Whizzerd looks down for a moment before looking back at Cassie. ‚ÄúWhizzerd wasn‚Äôt always Whizzerd,‚Äù he says softly. ‚ÄúWhizzerd used to be Matthias but Whizzerd knows nothing about him‚Äù stressing the last word. ‚ÄúEver since Whizzerd‚Äôs got here he‚Äôs been having dreams, of his life, of his experiences, but in these dreams they end up in one place, that place Charlie saw.‚Äù ‚ÄúThats the place is where Matthias ends and Whizzerd starts,‚Äù he explains as he does the final preparations. ‚ÄúWhizzerd‚Äôs going there, Whizzerd‚Äôs tired of not knowing about Matthias, he deserves to be remembered at least.‚Äù The half-orc expression softens a little as he finishes his tale. ‚ÄúWhizzerd‚Äôs sorry for dumping this all of you, but Whizzerd would appreciate the help. That faculty is dangerous and Whizzerd‚Äôs sure there‚Äôs plenty of valuables inside.‚Äù
Cassie BOT 18-10-2023 21:28
Cassie thinks for a moment before saying, "Count me in."

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 19-10-2023 01:58

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 19-10-2023 02:35

DM [Esh] BOT 19-10-2023 23:50
The tavern is bustling with its usual life. Tavern maids skirting to and fro the various tables, arms filled with mugs of ale, buskers jaunting out their new melodies and ballads, eager for some coin. But the newly formed band had somewhere else to be. Supplies packed and everything ready, the companions set out using the directions Cassie gleaned from the Black Rabbit. Setting out to the edge of the village Whizzerd recognizes a familiar form not too far in the distance... (edited)

Ellie Lightfall BOT 20-10-2023 00:03
In the distance, a knightly figure clad in draconic symbols and tempered metals stretches just off to the side of the path. Their slender prehensile tail flourishes and spins a small knife, not that it‚Äôd be much use in a fight. Hung from their back is a sheathed longsword, while an ebony coloured sheath accented with gold lotus flowers is attached to her hip, with its own sword covered by it. The women is facing away from the approaching group, as if silently pondering something. As they get closer, the figure‚Äôs tiefling horns gain detail. They have an almost scale or plate-like texture, each brown section separated by a darker band. ‚ÄúI really do wonder what‚Äôs happening out there‚Ä¶‚Äù

Ellie Lightfall BOT 20-10-2023 02:43
She drinks in all the information and people as a small smirk creeps onto her face. "A complex in the North? And Matthias? You know, I almost forgot things from other worlds can get pulled into here. Seems like you‚Äôre next on the list now. How dangerous do you think this complex is?" "And yes, i've had a number of fights in my life Mr. And Cassie! Good to see you again, hope your break was as good as mine. The calm is nice, but, well, its nothing like a good storm, or complex." She turns briefly to Thelgar, then Cassie, before going back to the group at large. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 11:32
The warrior of light, Ellie Lightfall joins the company. Continuing their travel using the directions of a half drunk bum, the group makes it to the forest edge where Charlie claimed the path starts. The group notices that the Mists hang thicker here, more dense and obscure fog rolls in and you can swear that it carries in whispers the screams of the past...
DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 15:04
The barbarian half-orc leads the party on with a fierce determination. The visions, the thoughts, the memories - unsure whether they are his or someone else's has driven Whizzerd and with the drunk's direction his drive now has a path. Whizzerd steps into the thick Mists closes his eyes and takes a giant's breath, breathing it into his lungs, breathing it into his pores. Maybe the Drunk's heavy alcohol had seeped into the clouds, leading Whizzerd towards the right direction? After a moment he does feel a little light-headed... but it could also be from holding his breath the whole time. Getting down on his hands and knees Whizzerd looks for tracks. He sees foot prints. But he sees many. One of them has to be Charlie's! Quickly standing upright Whizzerd is pretty confident which way to go. As confident as anyone with just the barely rudimentary skills of tracking would have any way...
DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 15:14
Following their leader into the fog, the group trudges forth through the dense forest but continuing only lead to a denser forest, and even more thickening fog, getting to a point where the companions could barely see the one in front of them. But despite the obscurements surrounding you, you're damn positive you passed that tree with the knot in it's bark that looks just a teeny bit like Bethel from Dusklight supplies, making you think whether you actually brought along enough potions or not. Too late now you shrug, the rest of the group on the precipice of getting restless, Whizzerd notices the Mists starting to disperse, making the way slightly clearer. The forest's density reducing as well with the spaces in between the trees becoming more spread out, the trees themselves not as thick as they were in the center of it. Several paces further and Whizzerd puts his fist in the air to halt the group, the Mists only only wispy tendrils around his arm. The group looks forward and sees, seemingly out of nowhere an entire village never beforr seen in Barovian lands, just as the drunk had said.
DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 15:16
Still at a wary distance you can see several structures lined up like a small town. Some can easily be recognized as stores and others as residential homes but what stood out the most even completely shrouded in the Mists was a structure that towered above all else...

DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 21:24
‚ÄúNot dwarven make‚Ä¶‚Äù Thelgar growls, peering intently at the strange architecture. ‚ÄúProbably humans. What‚Äôs a human city doin o... @Thelgar (@Ian [Scrihk¬π¬π|Thelgar‚Å∏] -5) - [jump](<https://discord.com/channels/@me/1086070698679738398/1164989139888906331>) Venturing forth, Thelgar is met with a striking array of architectural designs that he hasn't seen before; log cabins constructed from horizontally stacked logs providing shelter with their rustic embrace. Thelgar marvels at the way these buildings are built modestly yet with a strong resilience, but no inhabitants within or outside. The travelers continue their venture into the heart of the ghost town, the towering monstrosity always overhead and the eerie silence of the void of life - devoid of even animals or a breeze Different architectural structures unfolded. Here, intricately built woodworked buildings with ornate facades, balconies and porches that look like it would provide respite from the unrelenting sun of where the buildings were orginally built for.
DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 21:38
As Thelgar gives his tour of the town that he's never been to, Whizzerd walks through the streets in a daze as he is hit with semi-faded memories, unsure whether they were his that was lost or of the 'other'. Looking around, Whizzerd is able to identify various locations as places the dream-person has been to. Many of the buildings seem so familiar, like he's been there yesterday, and others nag of familiarity but just feels off. Focusing on these memories, Whizzerd eventually realizes that whether these are actual dreams or simply memories the 'wrong' buildings have been twisted or distorted in some way. One building has too many doors, another has their yard on the opposite side or missing vital parts of the structure that shouldn't be.
Whizzerd BOT 20-10-2023 21:40
‚ÄúSome of the buildings are wrong‚Äù Whizzerd says as he approaches one of the distorted houses, ‚ÄúCould coming here have distorted them?‚Äù (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 20-10-2023 21:45
But as he continues walking more personal memories assault him; He sees a structure that he remembers as a place where Mattias would purchase his supplies from. Another where he remembers seeing locals stumbling out of. A tavern? Whizzerd stops dead in his tracks. So real to him that he is unsure of whether this is another memory or a reality but a small little half-orc girls dashes through the streets, laughing and giggling, waving a colorful ribbon behind her, flying in the wind.
Whizzerd BOT 21-10-2023 05:05
‚ÄúMira?‚Äù Whizzerd calls as he follows the girl in an almost trance like style. A swarm of emotion washes over him, happiness, anger, sadness. A mishmash of half-remembered dreams and promises broken promises seems to enter Whizzerd‚Äôs mind. ‚ÄúNo, that can‚Äôt be Mira,‚Äù *Whizzerd says as he remembers what he has a mission, if he‚Äôs remembering correctly something dangerous lurks within this town and he can‚Äôt afford to get distracted.‚Äù ‚ÄúSeems like there‚Äôs nothing threatening us yet,‚Äù Whizzerd said as he brushed off what seems to be an illusion, ‚ÄúThis place seems to be the one Charlie mentioned, though I haven‚Äôt heard any cries yet.‚Äù (edited)
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 21-10-2023 05:18
Ro follows Whizzerd with his eyes as he walks following the illusion for a while, wondering for a moment what he is chasing. After Whizzerd talks, Ro replies: "Cries? Are we looking for someone being kidnapped here?" He takes a few small steps towards Whizzerd, his shortbow still held closely on his left hand.
Whizzerd BOT 21-10-2023 05:45
‚ÄúApparently Charlie heard cries of screaming and laughter,‚Äù Whizzerd explained, ‚ÄúCould be exaggeration on their part but considering how the rest of his tale was true I wouldn‚Äôt doubt it.‚Äù
Cassie BOT 21-10-2023 23:32
"I wouldn't put it past him to exaggerate," "Cassie says. "But I don't think he'd make up something like that out of whole cloth. Best we keep our eyes and* ears open."
DM [Esh] BOT 22-10-2023 02:45
Despite the phantasmal interruption, the companions continue through this displaced town. Walking through the empty streets frozen from another time and place an eerie aura continues to emanate from each of the structures, the heavy mists licking their heels with each step. The deadening silence actually a painful contrast to the creepy noises that the black rabbit patron described.
DM [Esh] BOT 22-10-2023 02:48
For what felt endless, they trekked through the silence until suddenly they all heard it. A shrill scream that pierces through the thick silence, so much more disturbing after the length of quiet they previously endured. The shriek sounded like it was in immense pain. And then they heard it again, as if whatever caused the pain was afflicted on the victim again. At inconsistent intervals these noises would continue.
Cassie BOT 22-10-2023 03:31
"Someone's in trouble," Cassie says, beginning to move toward the sound.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 22-10-2023 03:56
Ro glances towards Whizzerd. "Is that the sign of where we are supposed to go, Whizzerd? Or should we focus on the tall building?"
Ellie Lightfall BOT 22-10-2023 05:07
Ellie physically recoils at the sound, snapping her ears shut. She almost draws her sword, but then stops, resting her hand hesitantly on it instead. ‚ÄúIt could easily be a trap, as its the only living sound we‚Äôve heard. Theres too many unknowns to rule out an actual person though.‚Äù She watches and moves as Cassie moves toward the sound, choosing to lag behind her so she‚Äôs not too far from either group.
Whizzerd BOT 22-10-2023 06:18
‚ÄúWhizzerd doesn‚Äôt know but someone needs are help, but we should stick together either way.‚Äù Whizzerd follows after, Greataxe in hand.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 22-10-2023 06:24
"I suppose let's follow the sound then.." Ro, following the steps of Cassie, Ellie, and Whizzerd goes forward with them.
Thelgar BOT 22-10-2023 10:45
‚ÄúAn what‚Äôre THEY doin out here in the middle of nowhere??‚Äù Thelgar grumbles his misgivings, but follows the rest of the group towards the sound.
Cassie BOT 22-10-2023 11:17
Cassie proceeds carefully -- shield in one hand and whip in the other -- and keeps scanning the area for danger. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 22-10-2023 19:13
The scream dies as suddenly as it was heard leaving the group lost within the grid like streets of the ghost town unsure of where it originally was heard from. The dead silence returns, the void seeming so much deeper right after the screaming. But as you get accustomed to the returned silence, another noise pierces the air. This time a triumphant laugh. As if a person who has spent an indefinite amount of their life to an all consuming dedication, their life's work finally achieved. But that too suddenly vanishes on the still air.
DM [Esh] BOT 22-10-2023 19:17
The unnerving cackling sets your hairs on end, relieved it quickly ends but even with your guard up, attentive in these ghostly streets you were still not prepared when an intense giggle fills the streets. A giddy, happy laugh, all the more eerie from the previous sounds.
Cassie BOT 22-10-2023 20:57
Cassie shudders. "This place is getting creepier and creepier..."
Whizzerd BOT 23-10-2023 01:17
‚ÄúGuess it wasn‚Äôt an exaggeration,‚Äù Whizzerd comments as the giggling continues. Whizzerd closes his eyes and tries to locate where the sound is coming from. Listening for a direction.
DM [Esh] BOT 23-10-2023 03:47
The barbarian's sense are on overdrive as Whizzerd concentrates on the sounds around him. From everywhere and no where at once and as ephemeral as a passing thought, more sounds are heard within the ghost town. Whizzerd brings the party through one street where a cry echos through the shattered windows of an empty home only to be met with another interval of silence. This time the silence seems to be going on forever, for eternity, creating its own maddening aura. Desperate for something, the party wanders and without even realizing it find themselves standing in front of the towering facility. Standing before the monolithic structure the group becomes assailed by only some of the noises previously heard but this time simultaneously; the maniacal laughter, the screams of pain, the growls of frustration and outbursts of joy, along with countless of others. None able to be pinpointed, none able to be identified as if an entire world of emotions, thoughts and dreams have washed over the visitors, forcing them to buckle. Steeling themselves against the wave of emotions, Whizzerd and the others stand straight but as they look towards the facility it's as if they see it warp and shift, becoming intangible and tangible again. In its instantaneous transitions you can see the land shift back to the more 'natural' Barovian landscape but then back to its new form like it was ripped directly from the Maw itself, fully tangible. Real.
3
2
Whizzerd BOT 23-10-2023 04:25
Whizzerd pulse quickens as the building manifests. He drops to the ground, visibly shaken by its appearance. Tremors, heavy breathing, the whole nine yards, these reactions all seem to hit Whizzerd at once, dropping him to his knees. He looks like he‚Äôs almost about to puke. Whatever self proclaimed master caster or warrior you‚Äôve seen before you has dissipated. All that‚Äôs left is an animal, caged and alone, and afraid. All this happening almost instantaneously. For a few seconds Whizzerd was been reduced to this state, that is a certain item seems to glow on his chest and starts to glow brighter and brighter. One might confuse it for his crystals but seeing as the light turns to a soft gentle flame that surrounds the barbarian it‚Äôs clear that it‚Äôs draconic in nature. Whizzerd breathing slows and he slowly rises up. Still shaking slightly but no longer filled with terror as he was so before. ‚ÄúSorry about,‚Äù Whizzerd sheepishly said, ‚ÄúThat was‚Ä¶unbecoming of Whizzerd,‚Äù he takes a deep breath before continuing, ‚ÄúWhizzerd promises that won‚Äôt happen again, not with this thing around Whizzerd neck,‚Äù he says as he shows the dragon scale. ‚ÄúNow then, let‚Äôs get inside this building,‚Äù he says wanting to move on from what happened. She can‚Äôt let this place beat her mind either with its unfathomable magical logic. She touched her amulet, the one that reminded her of home, then tightened her shield against her wrist. Cassie BOT 23-10-2023 10:51

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 24-10-2023 01:15

DM [Esh] BOT 24-10-2023 06:48
Believing that they're fully prepared to for what ever may be within the monolith the group approaches the huge structure. Whizzerd takes the lead and takes a step forward, walking up to this strange metal and stone structure looking for a door or opening.. or something... But the building is sealed shut. No doors or no windows can be found nor any seams or cracks. Whizzerd tries to all he could to figure out how to get inside, to find the truth, to find himself. But despite his best efforts, the building shows no way of opening to accept the new visitors. Pulling, prying, pushing and even knocking ever so nicely doesn't seem to be getting Whizzerd nor his companions any further, frustrating everyone. As this is happening the structure starts to tremblem and Whizzerd quickly recoil his hand that had been touching the wall. A moment after that the land itself starts to shake and rumble. Another scream - similar to before - burst outwards. The crying, the laughing, the triumphant outbursts and bellows of disappointment, the screaming and the exctasy, all simultaneously flood your psyche, completely overwhelm your senses, invading your mind leaving some of you on your knees, though both the paladin and the half-orc both remain on their feet.
DM [Esh] BOT 24-10-2023 06:48
But the half-orc barely even registers the mental assault his companions are being afflicted by, though instead he continues searching the monolith, with an almost obsessed glint in his eye. Uncertain if the frustration has finally gotten to him or whether the psychic screams may have unlocked something deep within the Barbarian. Whizzerd's eyes dilute and retreat back into his skull. His feet and hands start moving as if of their own according, as if another consciousness is taking over. Whizzerd looks down and see hands that are his, but are not. They aren't as scarred as he remembers them. He also notices his forearms are not bare, but looking down whizzerd sees himself wearing a white sort of coat that he's noticed some others wearing in the Laboratorium. He let's his subconscious take over, letting the other self move his body. As he does so, his hands flirt along the side of the building, allowing his instincts to move them and this time they move with purpose and intention. PFFHHHHH His hands hit a certain location on the wall and a sound like high pressure is being released can be heard. An impression can finally be seen on these smooth, flat walls. A tiny slit is seen, an opening! A door! The door is finally opened but there is another; the crystals along Whizzerd's body start to dimly glow.

DM [Esh] BOT 25-10-2023 03:12
Dampening his other senses, Whizzerd opens up his awareness into the Weave and steps through the threshold of the building sends Whizzerd into another world. Pulsing at the same pace as the half orc's own crystals, Whizzerd sees the entire room filled with them. Growing from the walls, thrusting through the floors, impaling through equipment and fixtures. Surveying the room before him, underneath the growth of crystals Whizzerd sees scientific and medical equipment of all kinds. Along the walls, the barbarian can see tables and desks with leftover papers and equipment strewn all over the place. Focusing back towards his magical awareness Whizzerd looks around the room with a different set of eyes this time. Not seeing any active spells but he does notice residual magic lingering on various places throughout the facility; necromantic and transmutation magical auras from the various medical supplies and work tables, traces of abjuration, conjuration and divination on a table that looked like they were working on some loose crystals laid out and various other traces of different magic from various other tools, equipment and fixtures that Whizzerd couldn't identify.
Whizzerd BOT 25-10-2023 04:04

DM [Esh] BOT 25-10-2023 18:55
One of the more stranger things Cassie has seen she approaches one of the crystals within the laboratory with an inquisitive curiosity. Which one? Well, there were plenty to choose from; growing from the walls, loose shards on the floor, jagged ones smooth ones. She had her choice to choose from. Staring into the crystalline facets, Cassie can see the magic held within. Whizzerd was joking when he said there was magic all around here. Remembering back to when she still lived in Eberron and all of the magical and magical tech she had been exposed to she sees some similarities but is also able to work out other capabilities. Deep within a crystal Cassie can see active roiling and movement but of nothing tangible. Almost like an essence.. or the magic itself is trapped within and can't escape the crystallized prison. She goes to another and witnesses similar but different movement within. As if something else entirely is within but similarly imprisoned. Passing over several more and seeing several other reactions. Some similar as the prior ones, but others completely void inside. Either empty of an inhabitant or possessing a different function, Cassie can't make out but as she passed through many of them she felt something else... Some of the crystals had emanated an aura of the magical previously sensed, others filled Cassie with unexplained emotions.. rage, happiness, sadness.. but she is aware that they are not her own emotions... of others? Do these crystals trap more than just magic? Thinking on that, the rogue passes another one, this one seems to halt her momentum without her realizing it. She stares deeper into the crystal void. Her mind leaving the room that she's currently in, now only seeing darkness! ------------------------
DM [Esh] BOT 25-10-2023 18:55

DM [Esh] BOT 25-10-2023 18:56
Cassie regains her sight ||but she's no longer in the lab.. No, wait. She is. But it's brightly lit and none of her companions are any where to be found. She's also.. not Cassie. In front of her she sees hands that are not her own wearing hygienic gloves but coated in blood. She's standing over an unconscious body strapped to a surgery table. Her hands move on there own accord out of her peripheral but they return, one hand with a scalpel and the other holding a small shard of crystal. Her hand hovers the scalpel over the patient looking for the right spot for an incision. In panic, Cassie tries to move her hand, to throw the scalpel but nothing happens. She's only a spectator. Eventually the hand finds its mark and cuts. The patient wakes up from the incision, looks up at you then at the incision and then at the crystal in your other hand and starts to sob. Without pause your other hand brings the crystal to the incision where you implant it. The crystal takes hold of its host, growing slightly deeper into the body and gives off a dim glow. You look up and see a strange instrument, a lamp? You see something moving inside but can't make it out through the frosted glass though the figure inside seems to shift. This time the creature gets tugged, and hard. The two embedded crystals glowing fractionally brighter and the shrouded figure that much smaller. DM [Esh] BOT 26-10-2023 03:36
Whizzerd walks over to the lab equipment area, trying to deduce... something... but most of the equipment here seem to be things he doesn't recognize or have the knowledge on how to use. A lot of broken equipment though. Either dropped and shattered, impaled by crystal growth or decayed and deteriorated since it was last used. Deep in thought, trying to piece what he's finding together, Whizzerd doesn't hear the group behind him but picks up some sealed glass jars. Bringing it closer he sees each of them contain different specimens, several them have a crystal shard floating, each seemingly with a different liquid. Other containing other materials or ingredients and other things that Whizzerd can't identify. As he's about to put one back it slips from his fingers and falls to the desk before him.
DM [Esh] BOT 26-10-2023 03:38
but the jar bounces and rolls off the edge of the desk... # CRASH it falls to the floor. !!SHATTER!! The contents spilling out, the sound of broken glass echoing through the laboratory.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 26-10-2023 04:07

Just as he was about to turn to check up on Whizzerd, Ro hears what Cassie shared, and nods as he thinks about the implication. He turns to Ellie "You seem to know him before? What do you say of Whizzerd?"

DM [Esh] BOT 26-10-2023 23:59
Discovering all that they can from this room the group decides to delve deeper into this mysterious facility. Following the pathways and corridors, the party finds themselves in a similar laboratory from before but with different equipment and devices... But what caught their attention was not the giant mass of crystals at the far side of the room. No, it was the huddled masses in front of it. Kneeling and crowding the growth of crystals were finally some signs of life. You can make out several forms, one roughly humanoid sized but severely emaciated and a few shorter, squat creatures. You can't make out anything but from your current distance you can hear constant mumbling and murmuring. From other parts of the room you can make out other noises, scrambling pitter-patter being one of them. Have some stray beasts wandered into the facility?
Cassie BOT 27-10-2023 00:11
Curiosity and concern overcome her previous hesitance and Cassie begins to move forward, toward the huddled forms, to get a better look.
DM [Esh] BOT 27-10-2023 00:14
As Cassie takes a step into the room the laboratory explodes with movement!! From Cassie's simple step, you all can hear the echoing within the room, realization that the shattered glass practically being an alarm, other creatures who had been hidden until now rush towards you!!
3
DM [Esh] BOT 27-10-2023 02:31
A cacophony of incoherent shouting pierces the room. Two squat... creatures had been laying in wait for you. Hideous deformed creatures, each sporting a multitude of arms and two faces squashed into the squat headless body. Whatever sounds their gruesome mouths can let out are pain-filled rage. Grabbing whatever they can reach - shards of glass, laboratory scalpels and the like they rush from underneath their furniture hiding spaces and jump out at you!

Thelgar BOT 27-10-2023 11:50

1
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 27-10-2023 12:02
Ro was walking behind Cassie when suddenly the monsters attacked. He was too overwhelmed with the swarms attacking all at once, he didn't notice the big mouth threw something towards Thelgar. When he realized it, it was too late. Ro is blinded by the flash of light from the blob. But regaining his composure, Ro focuses on what's around him, just like he practiced in the Barovian forest against the wolves. Taking a deep breath, and recalling the positions of the monsters, Ro dashes forward. "Thanks for clearing the way, Thelgar!" Ro then stops near this noisy monster, then begins to assault it. He knocks the big mouth out, slashes it multiple times, critically injuring it, before he channels his ki to fester the injuries caused, resulting in the monster's demise. Ro then somersaults back, next to Whizzerd. He covers Whizzerd's eyes with his hand, and heals him of his injuries and his blindness, using the other side of the same energy he used to kill the big mouth. "Go forth and see them dead, Whizzerd!"
DM [Esh] BOT 27-10-2023 13:43
The tall, emaciated form rises from its kneeling position before the growth of crystals. Slowly it turns around showing its twisted, dessicated form, warped by the magic, warped by the experiments, warped by whatever else it may have been exposed to within these walls. It's eyes, crazed and darting across the room, unable to hold its gaze on any one point for too long. Erratic. It's mouth, constantly moving, constantly talking, chanting, whispering. But never coherent. Fingers forming to vicious claws. Scars race along its body and face. Crystals embedded, grafted, growing. It sets its eyes on the tortle but only for a fraction before its focus darts elsewhere and with superior speed it lunges forth. Tentacles, formed of skin and tiny crystal shards, looking almost like scales whips out from behind the creature and wraps around Ro. But in its quick movements, it shifts. Something else catches its attention. Out of familiarity? The next closest foe? The largest? It whips out a second tentacle, restraining Whizzerd where he stands. Still writhing in the creature's tentacle grasp it slowly moves towards Ro, jerking and shifting with every step. Squirming before it, the creature smiles with glee as it lashes out, the first hit grazes the hard shell, the creature recoils but strikes again. This one grazes across the monk, leaving deep wounds.

Thelgar BOT 28-10-2023 02:22

It's followed by the howling gale of frosty winter air spiraling around him, pelting the surroundings with ice and snow. The cats remain standing for now, but behind the dwarf another of the enemies collapses to the ground. (edited)

Thelgar BOT 29-10-2023 09:57

Then, moving far faster than an armored dwarf should have any right to, Thelgar begins to run. With every step he sends a shockwave rippling through the air behind him, disrupting the enemies as he weaves through their positions. Finally he aims a blow from his maul at one of the insane "patients", but misses. (edited)
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 29-10-2023 10:06

A glowing star, it emitted a myriad of greens and blues and hues she could not name, and it almost blinded her. But when she looked, she saw a figure in white, and sword in hand the figure cut the dark webs stemming from the monster entrapping her in her mind. The webs were like shadows, grasping at her in the space where light did not shine, and the figure defended her mind from them. The light faded away, and she could see clearly again. The figure was gone, but she no longer heard the voices in her head. Ellie resolved to continue the fight and went up to the last swarm in the room, missing once and hitting the second, the energy of both the light-arc and her blade killing some and injuring many more.

DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 00:21

Others who's performed their own work on these poor souls.

Thelgar BOT 31-10-2023 02:12
‚ÄúHmmph. Let ‚Äòem come!‚Äù Thelgar walks over to a conveniently-shaped piece of machinery and plops down to rest, his armor clanking as he sighs loudly in relief. ‚ÄúAhhh‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs better. Take a load off, then! Say Whizzerd, it sounds like this Matthias fella ran with a rough crowd. What‚Äôd you call it - The Maw? You got any idea what they wanted, or why they was slicin people up and puttin rocks in em?‚Äù
2
DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 02:27
As the group checks their wounds and equipment, getting ready to recuperate they hear moaning, growling and screaming of the lab's other occupants. They also hear rattling through the nearby corridors as metal walkways let out the groan of rushing feet. Though resting might be too risky, the noises are far off enough where the group can take a moment to examine the room that they're currently in.
Whizzerd BOT 31-10-2023 02:54
‚ÄúThe Maw is was Whizzerd‚Äôs world,‚Äù he said as he dropped his greataxe to take a break, ‚ÄúWe have a name for the people that runs these places, called them Machine People. Not they weren‚Äôt made of machines, they just worked with a bunch of them. Not sure why they would use crystals.‚Äù
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 31-10-2023 03:04
As the party takes a short breather, Ro takes two vials of potion, and asks around: "Anyone else needs some healing potions?" As he asks, he also walks around the room, examining the tools there, especially the medical ones. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 08:26
While examining the equipment before him, Ro also takes out his Wand of Magic Detection. Upon activating it, the room lights up like a beacon particularly the northern section of the room where a large crystal formation stands twenty five feet wide and just as tall in certain parts. Ro recalls a crowd of these creatures were huddled around it when the group first entered the room and waves the wand in that direction. Abjuration, conjuration, enchantment and transmutation magic can be seen residing within the crystals. The tortle steps closer, observing the mixture of magics within, as he approaches Ro experiences a similar interaction like Cassie had in the previous room but this one isn't an isolated memory. Instead Ro swiftly experiences a multitude of memories; of various patients - some of whom now lay dead. Memories that they've had within the facility, some of the trials and expirements that they've undergone but also of a time before. Ro sees some of them experiencing their life in the Maw as normal people. Their work, their family, their friends. Some of the memories rush by so fast that they are only an abstract sensation of emotion; happiness, anger, sadness, hope, fear and so on. As Ro returns to the present he also senses that these crystals are doing more than just absorbing and holding these emotions and memories, they're storing it, using it as energy as the crystals use it as some form of battery.
2
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 31-10-2023 09:36
Ro's mouth uncharacteristically stays agape, as he fell down to sit on the floor. "Ugh.." Ro says, as he tries to process all those memories and emotions, briefly inter-mingled with his own flashes of memory of his long-gone master.
Cassie BOT 31-10-2023 10:10
"You OK, Ro?" Cassie asks, concerned.
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 31-10-2023 10:27
Composing himself for a moment, Ro stands up again and turns to Cassie. "I saw.. visions, as well. Like yours, perhaps?" Ro glances at Whizzerd as he says the last part. Probably openness should be from both sides. Whizzerd has been quite open, perhaps it's time for them to be open as well. "I saw the memories? of many prior patients, it seems.." Ro says, slightly hesitant, but loudly enough to be heard by everyone. "I saw their normal lives, their time here, and some of them are... likely these patients here as well." Ro points to the bodies on the floor. "And, I sense that these memories are not simply present there.. based on the similarities to how I utilize my internal energy, seems like these memories are also used to power something.."
DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 15:16
The room dims in a magical glow as Ro's wand of detection reveals the auras and traces of magic around them. Passing by some of the machinery. Thelgar points out that some of the machines are used to cut and shape crystals. Others are to detect the magnetism and density. There are also chemistry stations that test the substance and analyze the chemical make up of the gems. Thelgar passes one that doesn't look familiar to him. Intrigued, he takes a few moments to examine it. Asking the group for a minute to look it over. Continuing his circuit around the room, Ro sees on the southern end another filing area. A desk and cabinets filled with more documents. Following Ro's path, Whizzerd steps forward to look through what lays before him. After spending some time sifting through the stacks and files of paper he displays several out in front of the group for them to see for themselves
2
DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 18:25
Displaying the papers before him, Whizzerd reads aloud,
**Doctor&#x27;s Log - Week 37** It is with profound regret that I report the unfortunate demise of Patient x121. Despite our earnest efforts to push the boundaries of our work, we find ourselves at an impasse. The experiments have, regrettably, not yielded the desired results. It is imperative that we intensify our research and make significant progress in the coming phases of our study. If we cannot reach our goals, I must emphasize the gravity of our situation. Failure to achieve the expected advancements will not only jeopardize the scientific integrity of our work but also expose us to the perilous consequences of forces beyond our comprehension. The Fi--ds of D--- will claim our very l---- an----uls. Need I remind you all, that we *must* find a solution to ending this threat, imprisoning Him, once and for all. Each life that is sacrificed is regrettable and fills each of us with sorrow but it is of utmost importance that we redouble our dedication and ingenuity in these endeavors, for the stakes are nothing short of existential. We must forge ahead with unwavering determination to avoid which looms just over the horizon, because without the sacrifices of those with tremendous valor we all will perish.. May our commitment to progress be resolute, and may we, through our collective efforts, rise to meet the formidable challenges that now confront us. *Dr.GR*
Some of the lines seem to be scratched out or faded, making it hard to make out. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 18:26
Whizzerd presents another. This document reads like a mission statement.
**The Machine People** Welcome to the intriguing world of the Machine People, a distinguished collective of scientists driven by a common and relentless passion: the pursuit of knowledge and discovery. Founded on the bedrock of curiosity and innovation, our journey began with the unearthing of ancient technology, setting us on an extraordinary path of exploration. At our core, we are the custodians of enigmatic wisdom, preserving the secrets hidden within the annals of time and machinery. As seekers of the unknown, we embrace the challenge of decoding the intricacies of ancient technologies, unraveling their mysteries, and pushing the boundaries of human understanding. The Machine People are more than just scientists; we are pioneers, explorers, and keepers of the past, driven to shape the future through our insatiable curiosity. We invite you to join us on this remarkable journey as we continue to push the boundaries of drow understanding and shape the future through the power of discovery.
DM [Esh] BOT 31-10-2023 18:31
After some time and some experimenting of his own, Thelgar let's out a gasp of intrigue. This device is like nothing he's ever seen before. The arrays of sensors and tools allow the user to scan the signatures of an inserted crystal allowing it to gauge the capacity of the absorption. It also allows it to be diffused, separated and re-inserted into another.
Thelgar BOT 01-11-2023 02:43
"Whoah!" Thelgar bellows, interrupting Whizzerd's rendition of the second letter. "Get a load'a this! This device - I know it! Err, kinda, anyway. Reminds me a the dowsing stations we've got back home for mineral veins... These fellers here-" he points to an array of instruments on one side of the device, "-they can scan one'a those crystals an tell ya how much it's gotten absorbed into a body. And these others, here..." He shoots a curious glance at Whizzerd and pauses a moment before continuing. "I think they can take the crystals out and put em back in!" He waits, curious what effect this information will have on their unofficial leader.

DM [Esh] BOT 01-11-2023 14:00
The tortle raises a small ring to his eye like a jeweler's loop, turning his head to get a scan of the room. For the most part, what is seen is the same but just with a narrower scope of view. The crystals shine just as bright through Ro's ring of truesight but their colors are brighter, sharper. Passing over the slain bodies Ro sees the misshapen and deformed but only as a superimposed overlay. The truesight has granted Ro the ability to see these people as they really are. Normal people, who used to lead normal lives. One of the forms is a young woman, plain looking. The other patient, a burly man but otherwise nondescript. The fused creatures actually showing an overlay of two seperate people over each other. A sad sight. But even worse - the mad, gibbering heap of flesh.. Ro sees a multitude of people piled as one mass of a creature.

DM [Esh] BOT 02-11-2023 15:46
With not much left to do in this room.. Other than wait for the thunderous booms to attract more of the denizens the group finishes up tending to their wounds and whatever they were looking over. The most obvious way forward is the gaping hole through a crystal formation that was previously blocking this path. In its haste to get to the intruders, one of the mutated patients charged through, shattering its way into the current room. Gathering forth, they step through the fractured breach, ready to delve further into the depths. Before passing through Ro makes one final sweep still looking through the ring. Behind some of the machinery, out of view from his previous angle, he sees a bright magical glow. Not realizing his Wand still pulsing, he sees a glow. Curiosity piqued, Ro mentions to the group to hold as he goes closer to examine it. The tortle sees the glow laid out on a workbench. Removing the ring from his eye and dimming the wand Ro sees it more clearly. A belt of some kind. Being held in place by some equipment and various tools laid out like its being worked on. Whizzerd, not far behind Ro suddenly stops in place. The proximity to whatever it is hums loudly inside Whizzerd's head, as if the surrounding crystals are resonating with Whizzerd's own.
3
Narrator (Threnchcoat) BOT 02-11-2023 17:35
Upon a closer inspection of the belt it seems like the tools surrounding weren‚Äôt used in making the belt. Rather, it seems like the machine people were trying to take it apart. The mission statement mentioned the unearthing of ancient technology so this must be one of those ancient machines. The belt it self is a work of art, even though this object must be thousands of years old the leather looks brand new. Intricate carvings of runes line the strap. The buckle of the belt seems to be made of the same crystals as everything else but unlike the usual rough shape the crystals that makes the buckle is cleanly cut.

Whizzerd BOT 03-11-2023 16:36

Ellie Lightfall BOT 03-11-2023 17:58

DM [Esh] BOT 04-11-2023 23:41
Once finished preparing themselves, the party steps through the breach completely invisible. Whizzerd though remains visible as a visual guide to lead the group forward. As silently as the group can muster, they move through facility but even with the group's best efforts their footsteps resonate against the metal floors. Traveling deeper they pass other sections of the facility many of which Whizzerd recognizes as rooms similar to the one they just left, though none being as big. Other rooms where other scientists could work on their experiments and possibly victims, hopefully advancing the Machine People's scientific progress and developments. Barely even registering why, Whizzerd glances back. Something was off. Taking a step back the half-orc looks into the room and notices a small section of the room that looks different from the others. The glowing from the crystals that radiate lighting (along with the few sconces they seem along the corridors) doesn't seem to reach these areas. The areas themselves also seem out of place, the surrounding metal walls convene but then meld into another material? Wood? In another section, another occurrence- a metallic work table shifts to wood. The color and atmosphere around those sections are palpable. A familiar gloom hangs over them... The familiar gloom of Barovia. Looking now with more intent there are other pockets like this in other rooms. Sort of like the facility you currently are in is.of a different world with pockets of Barovia seeping through. Is Barovia's presence consuming the lab or did the lab just not yet fully settle in these new lands?
DM [Esh] BOT 04-11-2023 23:41
Before anyone can spare a single thought on this matter a loud snarl can be heard. The sound is close. Too close. More snarls and growls can be heard. Quickly followed by a quick patter of multiples foot steps. With an instinctual sense Whizzerd pushes himself against the wall and not a moment after three of the short, squat malformed creatures run through the room. The rest of the party, still invisible, frozen in their place. The three creatures stand, look around and sniff the air. They pause as if catching something. They creep past Cassie, Ellie and Ro stopping directly in front of the dwarf. With malicious beady eyes the creatures scan the room, sensing but not seeing. One of the hideous creatures - with two sets of eyes quickly turn and turn but cannot find anything. Another with two sets of mouths puts its face almost up against Thelgar's own. The creature snarls, saliva dripping from its mouth and pooling by Thelgar's feet. The creature opens both of its mouths wider, as if in anticipation. But a loud howl is heard from within the facility, from another creature? Are there more experiments being performed? The noise brings back the creatures' attention who whip around and run out of the room, whipping past the out-in-the-open Whizzerd as if he too was invisible. Stepping forward from his corner, Whizzerd looks back and sees that he was standing in the "Barovia" part of the room. Is it possible that the creatures can only perceive what is truly in the lab? Looking back into the room Whizzerd sees the others starting to fade back into view, their invisibility ending.
4
Whizzerd BOT 05-11-2023 02:11

DM [Esh] BOT 05-11-2023 23:35
The room that the group was currently was bare other than what they've already looked at. There is nothing left to look over and so they head back to the previous corridor following where it leads. Continuing down the corridor leads into more of these little rooms, many of them containing patches of distortion to which the adventurers did their best to hug to maintain their cover and protect themselves from detection, as several more groups of the malformed creatures ran past with the adventurers unnoticed. Traveling deeper into the facility also affected the crystal growths. The crystals were growing substantially more as they delved further and further with formations and protrusions growing thicker and denser, making the facility more cavern like and less like the metal laboratories and workshops.
DM [Esh] BOT 05-11-2023 23:48
Several minutes later the group reaches a large, open cavern completely filled with crystal protrusions filling every surface. Crystal growths growing from the ground in a multitude of shapes and sizes actually crowd the enormous cavern making it hard to navigate. On the far side of the room Ro notices another group of the hideous creatures. This time several small ones but a few big ones accompanying them too and advises the others to blend into the shadows before everyone is caught! Taking note at the foes at the opposite end and you are able to determine that they have yet to be aware with you as they continue to snarl and fight amongst themselves as they seem to be attracted by various crystal groupings. But as you get comfortable in your positions, one of the taller experiments immediately stiffens, it's tentacles uncoiling and feeling around its area as if sensing something and as if synchronized, a second follows the first one's movements. As one being they turn to face the hidden group. During the first fight it was easy to miss in the heat of battle and with such dim lighting but the glow radiating from these crystals make it as clear as day - these patients show you their face - instead of eyes, they have hollow sockets, their senses more attuned to what is around them and they sense you! With a heavy shriek in your direction they charge forward with inhuman speed. Towards you!
Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 06-11-2023 13:12
Inhuman speed is Ro's game. He's inhuman, and he's speed. Ro dashes towards one of the aberration patients not blocked by his teammates, activating his tattoo on the way. Ro trips on one rock crystal, making his first slash goes wide, but his second slash injures the patient visibly. Ro then backsteps a bit to get closer to his allies. "I'll handle this side, Cassie you can handle the other side" Ro shouts to Cassie.
Cassie BOT 06-11-2023 13:16

DM [Esh] BOT 06-11-2023 14:23
The two patients sense, just as much as see the companions in this cavern, deftly locating their location and charge at full speed towards their prey. But just knowing where your target does means nothing when the lithe swashbuckler dancing around each strike, leaving the first patient dizzy. The tortle monk may need to take some dance lessons from Cassie. He carefully evades the first strike but gets caught in the second tentacle, causing the patient to easy land a second attack to rake across the tough shell.

DM [Esh] BOT 07-11-2023 03:53

Ellie Lightfall BOT 07-11-2023 06:49
Seeing the crystal creature next to her, Ellie instinctively dodges its attack, and retaliates with a single swift strike, finishing it off with a perfectly resonant burst of light. Then she weaves through the crystal formations, aiming for the heart of the barely living multi-armed patient. She lunges forward and ends its misery, before looking around the area proper and wondering if any of the crystals are amethysts.

DM [Esh] BOT 07-11-2023 14:37
Still absorbed by the intensity of the combat Thelgar overswings his great maul, shifting his stance, bringing him contact with the nearby crystal formation. As the dwarf touches the crystal a wave of a memory overwhelms Thelgar's senses. Amidst the bustling streets of a lively village, a memory unfolds. Boisterous haggling can be heard from the merchants and customers, laughter can be heard from the children running through the market but you see yourself walking through an aisle of spices. Piles of spices of all different variety, each overflowing their burlap sacks, the smells and aromas competing over the market stalls; you first pass the sweet and floral saffron, followed by a sack of cumin, its earthy scent filling your nostrils leaving a touch of robust and pungent smokiness. You walk up to the merchant, a large burlap in front of his stall overflowing with fine, dark granules. Sticking your hand into the sack and pulling up a handful and inhaling deeply. A wave of the bold and sharp aroma of the black pepper invades your nostrils, leaving a woody and pronounce heat that leaves your nose tingling. ‚ÄúHow much for a bag of this?‚Äù you hear yourself asking‚Ä¶ As Thelgar returns to reality a tiny shard pops off of the formation at his feet. DM [Esh] BOT 07-11-2023 14:48

But there is always something more when in Barovia.. or the Maw.. wherever... Within the wall a dessicated and gaunt corpse or a figure sits embedded, merged with the crystalline wall. But it is a particular sight. It's expression shows one of horror yes, but not as if trapped. Additionally, a single hand lay outstretched as if expecting to receive something, taking note of its face you also see that its missing a single eye, its nose, the side that is exposed is missing its ear and its mouth agape.

Ro Telt [justhalf] BOT 07-11-2023 17:26
Feeling that Whizzerd probably is their best bet in knowing who this figure is, Ro lets him walk closer, while he looks around in alert for more danger, and for any other weird crystals like Ellie and Thelgar experienced.
DM [Esh] BOT 07-11-2023 22:11
The implanted body seems to stare right at the approaching half-orc, it's open mouth almost screaming for answers of unspoken questions. It's arm outstretched as if pleading for Whizzerd to come closer. But through the grotesque visage Whizzerd recognizes the face beneath. Unsure of what he's actually seeing Whizzerd takes another step forward to make sure that what he's seeing is correct. Could it be? Matthias - Whizzerd - it doesn't matter refuses to forget that face, the name - Charlie Clay. Not remembering much else about the poor man except that he was Larson's last patient but the half-orc swore he wouldn't forget that face. Charlie Clay was the last patient Matthias Larson had ever performed on before Dr. Larson had been forced to undergo the experiments himself. It was Clay's fate that shook Matthias through his very core. Clay had made the most progress out of all of his prior patients, he had been able to withstand the most implants and his crystals had yielded the most energy retention as well as output, second to eventually Larson himself. But as his most resilient patient, Larson had been able to witness each and every break of Clay's sanity. Every day that Clay lost a part of himself, Dr. Larson lost a bit of himself too. The worst part was that insanity or bodily shutdown wasn't the cause of Clay's supposed death, what broke Matthias was that the crystals, a supposed symbiotic relation (albeit at a cost), devoured pour Charlie from the inside out. Like a devouring cancer, it the energy that Charlie poured into the gems doubled back into him; burning, consuming. Eventually just agony. Only agony. And Matthias couldn't let this continue. But Whizzerd remembers that Matthias had thought Charlie Clay had died. His body no more. But it seems that in their infinite intelligence and meticulous efficiency, the Machine People had other uses for Mr. Clay.
4
2
DM [Esh] BOT 07-11-2023 22:27
. After retracing his own partial memories, Whizzerd looks at the poor man embedded into the wall once more and notices another document partially sticking out from the wall. As carefully as he can whizzerd tears off the part attached to the wall and reads:
**Doctor&#x27;s Log - Week 11** I would like to report a fascinating new development with the capabilities of the crystals that continues to captivate and astound us! It appears that the absorbing nature of these crystals is profoundly influenced by the specific emotional and mnemonic imprints they assimilate from their hosts. The type and content of these memories, be they pleasant or distressing, bear remarkable influence over the crystals' responses, adaptations, and growth patterns. Moreover, these crystals exhibit growth patterns that differ according to the character of the imprints they absorb. It is as if they mirror the essence of the memories they contain, shaping themselves in a symbiotic reflection of their hosts' experiences. The implications of this phenomenon are profound, suggesting a dynamic interplay between the human psyche and these crystalline... entities? Intriguingly, we have also witnessed instances in which a crystal formation, already developed and firmly in place, undergoes a transformation in response to the presence of another crystal. This metamorphosis can manifest in a multitude of ways, encompassing growth, diminishment, or the assimilation of distinctive influences from the initiating crystal, forcing the already developed formation of crystals to expand or even retract. *Dr. GR*

DM [Esh] BOT 12-11-2023 15:35
Smoothing out the paper, the dwarf reads:
**Doctor&#x27;s Log - Week 8** A remarkable revelation has emerged from our ongoing experimentation with the crystalline containment procedures. These crystals, that we hope to use to confine the malevolent demon Dennoroth, have displayed an extraordinary capacity beyond what we previously believed. We have observed that, when integrated with a host, these crystals exhibit an ability to absorb and store a spectrum of emotions and memories, thus amplifying the strength of their containment capabilities. This unanticipated development signifies a profound augmentation to the potential of what can be achieved, putting our goals within sight. By absorbing the emotional and mnemonic imprints of their hosts, the crystal's abilities can be amplified a thousandfold. Take this into consideration when choosing your patients. *Dr. GR*

DM [Esh] BOT 13-11-2023 18:07
Whizzerd places the specific shards into the specific positions onto Charlie's body. One by one the pieces are put into place and the surrounding chaos seems to cease as the group waits for a reaction. But they didn't need to wait long. Almost the moment that the shards had touched Charlie, the wall itself hummed with life.¬†As if greeting long lost kin, the crystals sprout out to reconnect with the reunited shards. The new growth being imperceptible¬†as if they were always one piece with the wall. Now, the wall itself reacts. Violently it shakes! The crystals along the walls slowly start to recede, showing you all a path forward but in a quick jerk, it instead grows, almost impaling Whizzerd where he stood! As if at war with itself, the wall has several more random spurts of the crystals growing larger but then shrinking and receding and vice versa until the body of poor old Charlie expels out a few of the shards right back at Whizzerd, bouncing off of his chest and falling to the floor. Looking back at Charlie, you see the wall is slightly receded, a tiny hole now exposed, with the ear and nose shards remaining intact.

DM [Esh] BOT 14-11-2023 13:19
Cassie's fingers graze the nearby crystal and a wave of memories floods her vision‚Ä¶ Sitting in a moonlit garden, two lovers stand close, through another‚Äôs view you see the epitome of beauty before you; The deep blue of your companion's eyes look back at you. Both of your gazes lock in a shared moment of tenderness. A gentle breeze dances along your skin, amplifying the tingling your body feels in anticipation; fireflies lightly glow, highlighting the features of your lover‚Äôs face. They smile. You reach forward. The simple brush of skin against skin ignites a passion, a palpable feeling of safety and love that sends shivers along each of their bodies. You gently caress your lover‚Äôs cheek and they gasp in tender delight, slowly you graze your fingertips along their cheek, their neck, their chest, the warmth of dual touch sending sparks through both bodies‚Ä¶ Pulling away from the shard and the fiery tingles follow for just a second longer, a loose shard popping off into Cassie's hand.

DM [Esh] BOT 14-11-2023 17:19
Looking down at the shard in his hand, Thelgar notices another paper stuck to the bottom of his foot. Picking it up he reads:
**Doctor&#x27;s Log - Week 12** This memo is a follow up on the previous week's discoveries. Our past experiments had yielded tremendous results when the gems are manipulated to imprint specific memories. Stronger memories of course amplify the capabilities by a similar amount. But I would like to add to these notes that not only does the intensity of the memory affect the absorption capabilities but *what* the memories contain also contribute; a positive memory, one of a pleasurable sensation or interaction that the patient may have experienced encourages the crystals to form in a specific manner. Conversely, negative emotions, even if the patient themselves would not necessarily consider the experience as traumatic, but if it is trained with malice or corruption. This will seep into the crystal's imprinting and provide a different result. Though I would not say this second result is undesirable but something we can use to our advantage if we can properly manipulate it to our own desires. Something to costumer when choosing your patients and what events you encourage them to experience during the process. *Dr. GR*

The air is thick with stillness, and the windows remain shrouded by heavy, moth-eaten curtains, perpetually dimming the room. You sit lethargic, once a prolific wordsmith, uninterested, lost in the soothing embrace of complacency. *I‚Äôve sold a few books already* you think. *I have enough to eat! I‚Äôll do more work later.* you say to yourself, looking at the various things piling up around the room. *I‚Äôll get to it later, after this nap!* That nagging in the back of your mind goes silent, any worries or woes gone from your mind as the motivation you had once before has shifted to determination to instead focus on the now. And the now is to do nothing. Your creative spark has dulled into a lifeless ember, instead you focus on less important things, but you shrug it off as your eyes close once more, falling back into an unproductive sleep‚Ä¶

DM [Esh] BOT 17-11-2023 04:54
Taking a step forward, the half orc steps into a corridor of some sort. Sterile, neat, organized. Or at least it was at one point. But now through the decay of time and the ravaging of the experiments Whizzerd enters a completely different room. Layers of dust coat the floors, desks and nearby equipment open up to moderately sized room on a smaller scale than the very first room that the group had come into when entering the facility. Laboratory equipment of varying conditions of decay are scattered around the walls of the room, some fully broken and others as new as the day it was manufactured, except the dust of course. In other sections of the room lay desks, testing areas and sitting areas. At the other end of the room though stands a large, looming set of double doors of reinforced steel. Seeing the room in it's entirety sends Whizzerd's mind through a flashback. The room that they are currently in is a lesser laboratory. A place where the newly recruited and the apprentice scientists and doctors can work. And be monitored. In Whizzerd's mind's eye he sees Matthias - himself, standing by one of the desks looking into a microscope, fiddling with the dials until satisfied at what he was looking at. From behind Matthias, a tall and imposing drow walks up, peering over Matthias's shoulder. "Very good Dr. Larson! You hold great promise for the Machine People! Continue your good work" the man says as he touches Matthias's shoulder proudly than slows walks towards the double doors. The drow doctor puts his hand up to the door where an embedded crystal pulses out a crimson light over the doctor. After a moment, the double doors slide open, seemingly of their own accord. The lead scientist, that Whizzerd sees in a memory now remembers, the director himself stepping through the reinforced doors which close quickly behind him.
DM [Esh] BOT 17-11-2023 05:04
. Coming back to the present, Whizzerd looks back around. Everything is as it has been when they first walked in. Desolate and dusty. No director. No other scientists. Just whizzerd and his companions. But as he focuses on the present and whatever else is still left in this room, the room itself starts to shift. Phasing in and out of perception the workbenches and desks of the lab start to morph, changing shape. The old and broken steel machinery are replaced with apparatuses of brass that seem to still be in use and the alchemical supplies seem to have replenished instantly.. but of other reagents than what looks to have originally been inside. The desolate sterile but dusty room that you have just stood in, seems familiar to some of you, as you now stand in the Laboratorium of Barovia, except the steel reinforced double doors... which still stand ominously at the end of the room. It seems that this room has another distortion field but you feel it shifting and creeping as it seems it may not stay in this state for too long.

DM [Esh] BOT 19-11-2023 17:26
Running through the double doors into the unknown had to be better than waiting to be ripped to shreds by the incoming horde. Ushering the group forward Whizzerd commands the doors to close but it seems like an eternity as the horde can be seen gaining speed and gaining numbers. One of the patients give a burst of speed! It reaches the door and thrusts a tentacle forward making it through the threshold but luckily for the group just as the doors seal themselves shut severing it from the poor patient as it now writhes around on the floor.
DM [Esh] BOT 19-11-2023 17:28
Carefully the group turns around and they immediately know that this room is different from the rest that they've been through so far. Feeling the heat of multiple light sources, throwing shadows around the entire room. The cackling of electricity and the bubbling of boiling test tubes and beakers as alchemic concoctions are currently being brewed and tested. What set this room from the others - this was active and being used!
DM [Esh] BOT 19-11-2023 17:34
Looking forward, you noticed this room is longer than it is wide and it goes back. The walls lined with all sorts of science equipment; alchemy, geology, medical. And things almost impossible to identify. At the far distance you hear a pitched voice. "We are achieving the pinnacle of science! What we are doing here is paramount to our accomplishments! We will succeed!!" At the far side you see a hunched figure in a white doctor's robe, but it is anything but white. Not any longer. Tinged with brown, black and crimson as it's stained with fluids you are too scared to try to identify. The figure also sports several mechanical spider-like limbs from its back, each ending in a different tool arched over what looks to be another hospital table but leaning forward. You see a hideous creature strapped to the table, easily nine or even ten feet tall struggling against its bonds as the scientist continues his work.
Cassie BOT 19-11-2023 17:36
Cassie waits for Whizzerd's cue on what to do next.
Ellie Lightfall BOT 19-11-2023 18:29
She whispers very quietly, almost mouthing to the others. "Should we say hello?"
Cassie BOT 19-11-2023 20:31
Cassie counters with "I'd rather say goodbye."

Cassie BOT 19-11-2023 21:36

DM [Esh] BOT 20-11-2023 00:17
Lifting himself from his work while the robotic appendages still continues, the director turns around revealing a drow scientist weathered by age and turmoil. He raises his gloved hand to lift up heavy glasses from his brow to see who had called to him. "Dr. Larson? Haha it has been a long time doctor. We have not seen you since the accident. We all hope that you are okay. Your progress had always been so promising. Both when you had held the scalpel.... and when you were under it." The doctor gives Whizzerd a wide grin, but it is uncertain whether the cockeyed smile was a genuine greeting or a mockery.

DM [Esh] BOT 20-11-2023 06:06
The director's eyes widen in true fear. "Y-y-you.. H-how...?" The director points at Whizzerd with a trebling finger "Doctor Larson how is this so?? The crystals are meant to contain you. You should not be able to do what you are doing!" Doing his best to put some resolve into his voice, focusing on Whizzerd/Dr. Larson and not the entity within, "Has the fiend fully possessed you or have you invited him in?? What is the meaning of this Larson!? Your crystals should keep him at bay, not allow him to use you as a vessel!! And you there!" Directing towards both Thelgar and Ellie, "It seems you are not here to be recruited nor to assist in our duty to return the fiend to whence it came, instead you join forces?! No matter, while you were gone, Doctor, our experiments did not cease. If anything you were the catalyst to many more endeavors! Your ingenuity and procedures helped pave the way to new breakthroughs!" Commanding one of the mechanical arms to pull a lever, the hospital worktable steadies itself upright. The hideous creature now fully in view - this patient, with elongated limbs, thin and narrow is covered with just as many crystals as Whizzerd is, poking and protruding from every angle and body part. The elongated arms ending in wicked claws but the face, filled with pain and sorrow opens its stretched jaws to release a horrible wail. "Surely, you remember our esteemed colleague Dr. Puckett? She too showed promise but after long, we felt her contributions would be better served this way..." At the mention of the name, Whizzerd's mind is flooded with memories of Doctor Helen Puckett, if Whizzerd would use the word - one of Matthias Larson's most true and only friend while working in the facility. Seeing the tinge of recognition the director smiles, "Yes Miss Puckett will do just well." Pressing another switch to release her bonds he commands Dr. Puckett to handle the possessed Dr. Larson and company.
